content.intro: M7: Data In Sustainable Energy | Chapter 2

content.text: This chapter delves into the essential frameworks of planning, monitoring, and evaluation (PM&E) within sustainable energy development, focusing on strategic energy planning as a cornerstone for addressing energy security, economic growth, and climate change mitigation. It emphasizes the integration of resource assessment, infrastructure development, and stakeholder engagement to ensure energy projects align with national and global sustainability goals. Through case studies such as Azerbaijan’s long-term energy policy roadmap and Morocco’s application of the Open-Source Energy Modeling System (OSeMOSYS), the module demonstrates practical applications of energy planning tools in diverse contexts. It also highlights the critical role of PM&E in assessing energy initiatives' effectiveness, ensuring accountability, and driving continuous improvement. Furthermore, the module underscores the importance of incorporating gender-responsive and intersectional approaches into energy planning, advocating for data-driven strategies that address disparities and promote equitable energy access.
